title: Job Vacancies at Desicon Engineering Limited
content:
Desicon Engineering Limited for over 40 years has been an indigenous industry leader providing innovative Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) solutions to our clients. Knowledge, technical innovation and teamwork are at the centre of who we are. We are focused on leveraging these assets to deliver Instrumentation Maintenance and Construction, Procurement and Consultancy solutions to the Nigerian Energy sector. We are an ISO (9001:2008) certified organisation, and we are focused on continuing to improve our processes to exceed our client expectations. We are proud to be the first indigenous company to own and operate a fully equipped Electrical & Instrumentation facility with an attached calibration workshop; a further indication of our dedication to providing superior service and value for money to our clients.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Accountant

Job Location: Abuja
Job Type: Full-time

Position Overview


	The Accountant will be responsible for managing financial transactions, maintaining accurate records, preparing financial reports, and ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements.
	The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, analytical, and well-versed in accounting principles and financial reporting.


Key Responsibilities
Financial Recordkeeping & Reporting:


	Prepare and maintain accurate financial records and reports.
	Post journal entries and maintain the general ledger.
	Reconcile bank statements and resolve discrepancies.
	Assist in the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements.
	Process vendor invoices, staff reimbursements, and payments.
	Monitor accounts receivable and follow up on outstanding invoices.
	Reconcile customer and vendor accounts regularly.
	Assist in the preparation of budgets and forecasts.
	Monitor expenditures against budget and report variances.
	Ensure compliance with financial regulations, tax laws, and internal policies.
	Prepare documentation for internal and external audits.
	File tax returns and statutory remittances (VAT, WHT, PAYE, etc.) accurately and on time.


Qualifications


	Education: B.Sc / HND in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	Experience: Minimum of 3 years of relevant accounting experience.
	Professional Certification: ACA, ACCA (or in active pursuit) is an added advantage.


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of accounting principles and financial regulations.
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., Sage, QuickBooks, SAP).
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
	High level of accuracy and attention to detail.
	Strong organizational and time-management abilities.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Proximity to Maitama would be an added advantage 


Application Closing Date: 30th July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@desicongroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Heating and Air Conditioning Engineer 

Job Location: Bonny, Rivers

Role Description


	This is a full-time on-site role for a Heating And Air Conditioning Engineer located in Port Harcourt.
	The engineer will be responsible for designing, installing, and maintaining HVAC systems, conducting regular maintenance and repair, and utilizing Computer-Aided Design (CAD) tools for system design and analysis.
	Day-to-day tasks will include ensuring HVAC systems operate efficiently and effectively, troubleshooting any issues, and collaborating with other engineering teams to meet project requirements.


Qualifications


	Expertise in HVAC Engineering and HVAC system design
	Proficiency in HVAC installation, maintenance, and repair
	Experience with Computer-Aided Design (CAD) for HVAC systems
	Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
	Excellent communication and teamwork skills
	Ability to work on-site in Port Harcourt
	Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field
	Experience in the energy sector is a plus.


Application Closing Date: 31st July, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Front Desk Administrator

Job Location: Abuja

Job Summary


	The Front Desk Administrator is the first point of contact for all clients, visitors, and employees.
	This role is responsible for managing the front office efficiently, ensuring smooth daily operations, and delivering exceptional customer service while providing administrative support to various departments.


Key Responsibilities


	Greet and welcome visitors professionally and direct them appropriately.
	Answer, screen, and forward incoming calls; take messages when necessary.
	Manage the reception area to ensure it is clean, tidy, and presentable at all times.
	Provide administrative support to staff as needed, including data entry, filing, and document preparation.
	Handle incoming and outgoing correspondence (emails, letters, packages).
	Receive and sort daily mail/deliveries/couriers and distribute them promptly.
	Schedule and coordinate meetings, appointments, and conference room bookings.
	Maintain visitor logs and issue visitor badges.
	Maintain office supplies inventory and place orders when needed.
	Support onboarding process for new hires by welcoming them and providing orientation materials.


Application Closing Date: 31st July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@desicongroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Officer
Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

            
    




	As a Team Member, you will work to improve the organization’s market position and achieve financial growth.
	You are expected effectively manage your team to meet and surpass targets in addition to defining long-term organizational strategic goals, build key customer relationships, identify business, opportunities.
	You are expected to exhibit pristine knowledge of the finance and investment industry.


Roles & Responsibiliies


	Business Development and Client Retention

	Effectively manage assigned team to meet and surpass targets.

	Prepare sales pitches, presentations and other documents required for client’s engagements.
	Assist in the development, launching and sales of new product offering.
	Act as liaison between the company and existing/prospective clients.
	Responsible for ensuring the coordination, execution and monitoring of an extension of credit through the approval to maturity including the following Serving as the primary interface with the client.
	Ensuring a complete, accurate and balanced assessment of risk in the credit approval presentation
	Coordinating the approval process? managing information flow and ensuring that the credit follows the stated approval process for the facility limit.
	Ensuring that clear communication between the company and the client is maintained, and that the internal approvals are consistent with client expectations.
	Ensuring compliance with related policies, especially the credit policy
	Ensuring that the approval documentation is complete.
	Ensuring that the legal documentation is complete, consistent with the internal approvals and properly executed and filed.
	Ensuring quality and timely service delivery, within (or exceeding) customer expectations.
	Monitor industry trends and obtain necessary intelligence to be used as input for new product development

	Prepare call memos and progress reports on negotiations with debtors in respect of repayment of indebtedness.
	Follow up on release of security documents for loans which have been fully repaid

Administrative Assistant Job at University of Benin (UNIBEN)




        
    

        
        The University of Benin (UNIBEN) is a government-owned tertiary institution, established on the 23rd of November, 1970, by the then Colonel Samuel Osaigbovo Ogbemudia-led military administration of Midwest State. It started as an Institute of Technology and was accorded the status of a full-fledged University by National Universities Commission (NUC) on 1st July, 1971. In his Budget Speech in April 1972, the then Military Governor of Mid-Western State, Col. S. O. Ogbemudia (then also Visitor to the University) formally announced the change of the name of the Institute of Technology to the University of Benin. On 1st April, 1975, the University, at the request of the State Government, was taken over by the Federal Government and became a Federal University.
     

            
    



Applications are invited from suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Assistant

Job Location: Benin City, Edo
Career level: Senior Level

Requirements


	Candidates should possess a good honours Degree not below Second Class (Lower Division) from a recognised University
	Must be computer literate.


Salary Grade
CONTISS 07

Application Details


	Candidates should submit soft copies of their Applications with detailed Curriculum Vitae, photocopies of Credentials and supporting documents via the link above.
	Applicant's CV should be presented in the following order:
	
		Full Names (underline Surname)
		Post Applied For
		Date and Place of Birth
		Permanent Home Address
		Contact Address
		Mobile Phone Number(s)
		Email Address
		Nationality
		State of Origin
		Local Government of Origin
		Marital Status
		Number and Age(s) of Child(ren)
		Institutions Attended (with dates)
		Academic Qualifications (with dates)
		Professional Qualifications (with dates and awarding bodies)
		Work Experience
		List of Publications (where applicable, in chronological order)
		Membership of Professional Bodies
		Community Service Rendered
		Extracurricular Activities
		Names and Addresses of Three Referees
		Referees must send their reports (not longer than one week after close of application) directly to the Registrar under confidential seal with subject heading bearing the name of the applicant and post applied for. At least one Referee must be from the applicant’s most recent/current place of employment
	
	


Note


	Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
	This Job advert is open to both internal and external candidates

Account Officer Job at Tribitat Real Estate




        
    

        
        Tribitat Real Estate offers commercial and residential real estate development services to individuals, public and private organisations through the provision of high quality affordable construction management, project management and entitlement processing services.

We recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Officer

Job Location: Ajah, Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Accounts Officer is responsible for managing financial records, updating client databases, and ensuring accurate entry of transactional data for the organization.
	This role is critical to supporting the daily operations of the finance and sales teams, with a strong focus on accuracy, confidentiality, and accountability.
	The ideal candidate must possess excellent attention to detail, good communication skills, and a working knowledge of basic accounting principles, particularly in a real estate setting.


Key Responsibilities


	Accurately input financial and client transaction records into relevant systems.
	Verify and confirm receipts for all property-related and operational transactions.
	Manage and update client details across databases on a daily basis.
	Calculate and record realtor commissions daily.
	Track site-related expenditures and property transaction receipts.
	Assist the CEO with daily updates on client ROI and relevant financial summaries.
	Process staff salaries and ensure accurate deductions and tax remittances
	Managed petty cash and ensure proper documentations of office related expenses
	Record operational expenses and maintain a schedule of outstanding payables.
	File and document all financial records and client transactions promptly and accurately.
	Liaise with other departments to support timely financial reporting and record-keeping.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an OND/HND/B.Sc. in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	Minimum of 1-3 years of experience in a similar role (real estate experience is a plus).
	Strong knowledge of MS Excel and basic accounting tools/software.
	High attention to detail, accuracy, and organization.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to handle sensitive data with integrity and confidentiality.
	Self-motivated, proactive, and able to work with minimal supervision


Note: Proximity is key
